greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: CU(n,k) is the number of unlabeled subgraphs with k edges of the n-cycle C_n.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1274
formula: T(n,n) = 1; T(n,k) = Sum_{i=k+1..n} A008284(i, i-k) for k < n. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Sep 26 2019
example: For row n = 3 of the triangle below: there are 3 unlabeled subgraphs of the triangle C_3 with 0 edges, 2 with 1 edge, 1 with 2 edges, and 1 with 3 edges (C_3 itself).
program: (PARI) \\ here P is A008284 as vector of vectors.
T(n)={my(p=P(n-1)); matrix(n, n, n, k, if(k>=n, k==n, sum(i=k, n-1, p[i][i-k+1])))}
results.author: _John P. McSorley_, Nov 21 2016
ext: Offset corrected and terms a(66) and beyond from _Andrew Howroyd_, Sep 26 2019
